development.translation[0].definitions[0: the process of gradually becoming bigger, better, stronger, or more advanced
a course on the development of Greek thought
development.translation[0].definitions[1: the process of increasing business, trade, and industrial activity
development.translation[0].definitions[2: a new event or piece of news that changes a situation
recent political developments in the former Soviet Union
We will keep you informed of developments.
development.translation[0].definitions[3: the process of working on a new product, plan, idea etc to make it successful
The funds will be used for marketing and product development.
Spielberg has several interesting projects under development.
development.translation[0].definitions[4: a change that makes a product, plan, idea etc better
There have been significant computer developments during the last decade.
development.translation[0].definitions[5: the process of planning and building new houses, streets etc on land
The land was sold for development.
development.translation[0].definitions[6: a group of new buildings that have all been planned and built together on the same piece of land
development.translation[0].note_box[0].h: – Meaning 2: the process of increasing business, trade, and industrial activity
development.translation[0].note_box[0].s: The US has been keen to encourage economic development in Egypt.
a programme of regional development in Eastern Europe
The government is committed to sustainable development and the protection of the environment.
The Overseas Development Minister announced a £7,000,000 emergency aid programme for Somalia.
We need to facilitate development and economic activity that provides jobs.
Further funds are required to allow the development work to continue.
Education made up 22.5 percent of development aid last year.
development.translation[1].definitions[0: the growth or improvement of something, so that it becomes bigger or more advanced
promises of economic development and thousands of new jobs
development of the hand-held dictionary market in Japan
She saw the qualification as a part of her professional development.
helping staff with their career development
development.translation[1].definitions[1: the process of planning and making new products or providing new services
The new phone is the result of two years of development by AT&T units.
The Japanese approach to product development is spreading around Detroit.
development.translation[1].definitions[2: the process of planning and building new houses, offices etc, or improving existing ones
the development of office buildings, shopping centers and apartment complexes
development.translation[1].definitions[3: a group of new buildings that have all been planned and built together on the same piece of land
low-income families living in high-rise housing developments
development.translation[1].definitions[4: the process of creating a plan, policy, or idea
the development of a coherent transport policy
development.translation[1].definitions[5: the using of a natural substance or product in order to make a profit
This includes $370 million for the development of the East Brae Field in the United Kingdom North Sea.
development.translation[1].definitions[6: a new event or piece of news that will have an effect on the present situation
The G-8 will discuss international financial developments, including the continued weakness of the yen.
